roleset.name: be owned by
roleset.note: BELONG-V NOTES: Frames file for 'belong' based on financial subcorpus; nominal 'belonging' based on BOLT-7. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'own' and 'include'. (from belong.01-v)
BELONGING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from belonging.01-n)

example.name: belong-v: belong with
example.text: Even some members of the Old Guard, despite their current advantage, seem to be conceding that the future belongs with the New Guard.

example.name: belong-v: belong on, less obvious group
example.text: You are so damn dumb that you don't belong on Wall Street.

example.name: belong-v: belong to
example.text: This beat-up teddy bear belongs to John.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Neighboring places heavily influenced by " Asian values , " such as Japan , Korea and Hong Kong , have a strong sense of how important it is to belong to " the educated class , " just as we do here .

example.name: belonging-n
example.text: His perception of his belonging to Poland is different to his parents' perceptions.
